channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The light is out on column 22 Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve, 11th December
item.description:
Opposite Stella Way
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very Large pothole as heading towards cleeve from Wyman’s Lane, 10th December
item.description:
On Hyde Lane just after houses as you head towards bishops cleeve from Wyman’s lane on the edge of the road. Pothole is very large and deep and difficult to avoid when there is oncoming traffic as not much room to avoid - in the national speed limit zone. Caused me to pop my tyre in the dark which needed replacing and cost £150. I am requesting reimbursement for the cost of repairing my tyre, which was damaged after hitting a pothole on a council-maintained road. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedging hasn't been cut for 5 years, 10th December
item.description:
This should only be a small hedge but hasn't been cut since the home expanded and blocked the previous entrance. It is now being used as a dumping area and toilet!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salvia Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BOTH street lights have stopped working, 10th December
item.description:
The street lights between numbers 1 and 4 shelley road have stopped working, this has been reported before, this makes the whole end of the road pitch black and dangerous. This has caused several nerves miss accidents with pedestrians and cyclists

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Shelley Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes dangerous, 10th December
item.description:
From cheltenham direction under the bridge and around 50 yards past the houses there is a huge pothole either side which are both deep and as a bus driver along that route daily we have already seen vehicles getting into grief. They are dangerous and need attention immediately
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concrete broken, 10th December
item.description:
Concrete has been used 3 times to fix this kerb and on each occasion has broken up after 3 months. A permanent solution needs to be found like proper kerb stones

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intimidating horse blocking public footpath, 10th December
item.description:
There is a male black and white horse that has been blocking access to the public footpath which is reached via Bushcombe Lane / Jasmine Cottage, and then right through two open fields before arriving at a more wooded area. This horse has previously followed walkers / runners in an intimidating manner in the past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlights are out, 10th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Fairmount Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pothole, 10th December
item.description:
Outside 163 Hewlett Rd. This pothole has been reported previously with the last repair lasting 4 days. I have reported it again to receive a report that it had been fixed which is untrue as the photo shows.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163a, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
